author: chsistemas2209
title: System to manage patient care
description: The idea is to use blockchain to allow patients and doctors to relate directly to each other and close deals, without there being a central entity managing the care service.

f6_assessments.q0: The team behind this proposal aims to develop a blockchain application that allows storing patient and physician information. The blockchain's own encryption provides a high level of security against theft, manipulation or cyber attacks. The idea is to use blockchain to allow patients and doctors to relate directly to each other and close deals, without there being a central entity managing the care service. The problem statement and solution are both clear in their explanation. The manner the proposer addressed both the problem and the relevant proposed solution is quite valuable. I absolutely like the noble idea. According to the proposal, the goals are to provide innovative solutions for patient information and to increase the number of potential users of the Cardano ecosystem. As a result, I agree that this proposal meets the goals of the challenge and adds value to both the healthcare system and the Cardano ecosystem. Also there is certainly room for improvement on the solution presented here. It would be a good idea to include a few extra words outlining the impact for the community as well as mention why and how the Cardano ecosystem will grow if this proposal is implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has already shared their comprehensive budget breakdown with the community. The budget is thoroughly specified and broken down on each cost of the necessary equipment for the data center's operation. Nonetheless, I was left wondering where the compensation allocation for team members was. I see that several responsibilities in the project are mentioned; how are they paid? Similarly, information is lacking in other sections of the plan. There is a brief mention of an implemented plan, but it is not precisely provided in the part of an executed plan, which only offers a vague picture of the activities to be carried out. Unfortunately, the timeline and milestones are completely absent from the plan. The author does not indicate which steps would be required to complete this project, how the sequence of activities that would comprise the whole would happen, or how long each one would last. We have no clue how this project will be developed, thus the author must establish a timeline of activities so that we can comprehend the process rather than simply the result. Furthermore, the team performed a poor job of introducing the team members. They did not specifically specify each team member's experience or expertise or proficiency in the fields required in this proposal. Although all important links and references are provided to validate the project's credibility, it is always preferable to give a clear presentation of the core team. Another point of concern is that the plan mentions specific roles such as two Plutus and Haskell expert programmers, one server configuration specialist, and one transcriber to document the proposal, but does not specify if they have already found the specialists to engage or are still looking. I don’t either understand why such info was placed in the section of an executed plan though? As of the time of this writing, there was no evidence that they had found their developer (correct me if I am wrong). As there is no extra technical information accessible that sheds more light on the viability of this project, I believe a "whitepaper" would be very valuable, even if it was brief, to clarify how the technical part would be handled. A more complete description of the cited aspects should increase the viability of the proposal. In order to visualize how this plan might manifest, more background on the project's team members, their salaries, and their roles in this would have been helpful. In summary, I question the feasibility of this proposal and hope to see the proposer make significant improvements.
f6_assessments.q2: The problem statement and solution are well-connected and accurate. Unfortunately, that is the only thing I find positive about this idea. Sad to say, this proposal lacks a defined roadmap and timeline for achieving the stated goals. It also lacks relevant KPIs or success criteria that would allow us to exercise project auditability. If there was a script with very detailed phases, we could keep track of whether such activities were taking place, as well as if they were achieved within the time frame specified. However, there is no type of information, thus the Cardano community cannot identify or follow the outcomes. To improve the score, I would advise the proposers to more clearly define how the community may be involved or kept informed of the project's development and success. Additional details on what, when, and how you intend to build a solution will be required when resubmitting. I believe that a wonderful idea like this would be served well if a reasonable amount of effort was put into developing a well-outlined action plan with stepwise success definitions.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal centers on bringing the benefits of blockchain technology to the doctor-patient relationship and more generally open the university medical market to Cardano. As this is not the first time this has been attempted
(https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S266660302100021X#)
 it would have been great to see some discussion of existing approaches, opportunities, risks and a Cardano-specific discussion.
The milestones and project description are kept relatively vague and I would have liked to see use cases and a clearer description of the proof-of-concept this particular funding request would produce. Descriptions of possible DApps and the type of targeted clinics and doctors would have been very helpful.
I agree that decentralization and democratization of health care is a potentially extremely impactful area. MedTech apps are being greated for off-chain an on-chain solutions, and how this initiative differentiates is critical to make an assessment of the likely impact. As in its current form the proposal seems to be only about preliminary research, setup and the onboarding of Cardano developers, and there are currently no Plutus practitioners or doctors on the team or in the portfolio of the proposal, I neither agree nor disagree that the impact will be high and the challenge brief of boosting Cardano's user base and available DApps will be supported with high effectiveness.
f6_assessments.q1:
The scope of this proposal is currently quite narrow, with a data center and software creation the first step in a larger project that would be implemented over several funding rounds (with or without Catalyst). Therefore, it should be possible to finish the project as described.
I would have liked to see a more detailed timeline to better understand what exactly the likely challenges in creating the software might be. 
The budget breakdown is extremely detailed and given the limited scope of the proposal the budget seems sufficient. 
More explanation about existing Haskell skills and funds allocated to hiring or contracting Plutus experts would have been great.
The LinkedIn profiles of the team are provided. All proposers are university professors from Venezuela so it is likely that they will be able to work well together.
f6_assessments.q2: The Auditability section partially contains the form question pasted back as the answer. Where unique content has been provided, it is very brief and does not clearly address the question, i.e. the proposal is missing KPIs, ways to provide feedback on the progress of the development, and significant milestones that could be understood in terms of what steps will be taken to research and deliver a proof-of-concept product. The proposers have project management know-how and will employ agile techniques, but do not elaborate or provide external links to back up the claims. I would have liked to see a lot more information, even if linking to Spanish external websites or other such sources that I can translate or validate. While the goals and target market of the proposal are excellent, I am not confident that Project Catalyst would have sufficient information to understand what is going on or what we can likely expect from this project given the information provided.

f6_assessments.q0: According to my understanding, the goal of this project isCreate a blockchain application for storing patient and physician data. I liked the overall concept, the project proposal, and the overall stated tasks and milestones, which seemed like a reasonable notion to me, not only for the desired investment value but also for the entire project proposal. Furthermore, I would have loved to see more particular facts about the project's progress. The underlying idea and concept are fantastic, however additional detail is required for me to evaluate the proposal since how the proposed solution will address the challenge is not clear enough to align with the key metrics.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan should outline how the deliverables will be achieved. The team has extensive experience, and the proposal has sufficient material to prove it. For some years, the team has also been working as  teachers in the IT area in the development of client - server applications. There are links that can be used to double-check the facts (Linkedin links, for example). The budget is clearly specified and broken down into identifiable items, and it is reasonable in order to meet the established goals. I estimate that the cost is reasonable to achieve the set goal , but maybe more funding will be required. The difficulties associated with a successful implementation have been considered. However, I could only ask if there is a realistic timeframe for completing the outlined work and although it may be difficult, I could see actual figures rather than words when referring to the number of ideas in the KPI and Metrics section Finally, I would have liked to see a more detailed explanation of what the project wants to accomplish in order for the proposal to be more tangible. I have no opinion on whether or not this plan will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The key metrics are not measurable for the most part however the success criteria is adequate. To improve challenge: better articulate how the success criteria address the challenge and how the metrics can measure progress towards the success criteria. The author should consider the following ideas for future Catalyst cycles: Create a road map showing the steps that must be taken in order for this strategy to be effective. A timeline should be given at least every three months. Furthermore, it is necessary to establish specific success criteria, ideally tied to dates, such as XX conferences will be held within XX months.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal suggests developing a blockchain app to store patient and physician information. They want to have a care service system which is secured by Cardano blockchain. It’s good for both care service system and Cardano.  Everyone can participate and verify the information so it will increase large number of potential users using the Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: There five people in their team and all of them are professors about computer science. I suppose that they have knowledge about their project. However, this project is built on Cardano blockchain, they should need more people having experience about developing on Cardano blockchain. They suggest a budget $20000 for hardware equipment but they don’t have any plans for design and build the app. One more thing, in the proposal, they claim that any doctors can access the patients’ information so how can the project protect sensitive user information?
f6_assessments.q2: They haven't had clear key metrics yet. They should have plans and solutions for auditing the “System to manage patient care” project. They should publize data of their project. They also need to create website, Twitter or Telegram for tracking the project. The project is a community project so it needs to be decentralized and transparent. They also pay attention to the security of their app. They should have solutions for the security of the system.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal dialogues with the goal of the challenge of encouraging development of blockchain application to store data and information about patient and the physician. The proposer argued that using blockchain to create the system for storing data and information will prevent from the theft, data manipulation and others cyber-attack. Since the team will to carry this project, I would like the proposer make clear the person in charge / responsible of this project also his/her experience. This information will help to find right person to responsible of this project. On the other hand, the information provided looks like unorganized. For example, in the part of “Impact on how to propose the solution to address the challenge”, the proposer / author, should describe, what is the system develop in the blockchain and what would it name it. furthermore, how the team promote this, to whom this system be promoted. Such questions should be answer and explain in this section. Meanwhile, the information that already provided in the “Impact on how to propose the solution to address the challenge” can put in the “feasibility plan” thus, it will enrich the plan information. Although, the information un unorganized, the information is there and address the challenge
f6_assessments.q1: When asked if the plan can be executed, we need to look at if the plan is doable. Thus, there is information about the plan although unorganized as I mentioned above and budget information provided. About the plan, there is script in the ‘Impact section”, however, the plan supposed to divided into phase. Many proposals establish phases, this is because we understand well what would happen but not when it would happen, that is, when each thing would start and end, which is essential for a full understanding of the activities including developing system to store data and information patient and physician. In relation to budget, there is cost allocation for hardware but no cost allocation for developer, perhaps the proposer consider cost for developers e.g., developer fees. Overall, the plan is alright and I think proposal will be implemented successfully
f6_assessments.q2: Speaking about auditability, I believe the authors intended to propose an auditability. Perhaps the authors could state the measurement that in line with the plan. For example, the first two months to develop the applications. Therefore, what measurement determine develop application e,g, project initiation, requirements collection, analysis, planning, designing, development, testing, deployment, maintenance. This can use as basis information to audit the progress in first two month (Phase 1). Thus, this way can apply for second plan and third plan of your project i.e., verifications and validations and documentation. Given information is provided, I neither agree nor disagree the information sufficient to audit the progress.

f6_assessments.q0:
"The potential for blockchain technology applications is tremendous. Healthcare is one of the promising fields for blockchain technology in general, and for Cardano ecosystem specifically. This system allowed storing patient and physician information. Thanks to the blockchain technology, the information can be protected against cyber-attacks. The target audience for this project could be medical suppliers, pharmaceuticals, health institutions, etc. 
Beside the financial risks reported, I would like to ask if there existed the risks from competitors. Since the idea of applying blockchain technology into healthcare industry was not completely novel. How does this platform differ from the other block-chain based healthcare platforms?
This solution could also reduce the paperwork used to store the information of patients. The success of this project may attract the interests of many healthcare institutions; and this benefits the Cardano ecosystem. Thus, this solution is aligned with the challenge. 
"
f6_assessments.q1: The roadmap should be more specific: the proposers should divide the main tasks into smaller sub-tasks, provide the exact timeline for each task, and if possible, provide the execution methods for the tasks. In terms of the budget, the proposers listed out the equipment cost needed. However, in my opinion, this proposal lacked some costs such as the salary, product marketing & launching cost (to the healthcare institutions). The core team members are professors having strong background in computer science, so I do not have any further recommendations.
f6_assessments.q2: Since this project is related to healthcare, the Sustainable Development Goals Rating was used here. From my point of view, the proposers should use some KPIs/metrics apart from the XP methodology. I recommend using some KPIs such as the number of patients, the number of collab healthcare institutions, etc. Moreover, and I strongly advise the proposers to include the actual number of KPIs/metrics they plan to attain in a certain period of time. Moreover, the proposers should have some forms of communication to the community in terms of their progress.
